Class MainForm

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • MainForm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class MainForm
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The MainForm displays an interface providing various features to the user wishing to access the database.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nathan Kiernan 15088410
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainForm

        public MainForm()
         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                java.io.IOException
        A constructor for the MainForm which displays it's GUI components as specified by it's GridBagConstraints. It helps the user interact with the database in various ways.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the SQL query fails to generate.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO operation fails.

    • Method Detail

      • uploadImage

        public void uploadImage()
        A method which allows the user to upload an image from their file system and store in the database as an Employee's image. It only accepts image type files (.jpeg, .jpg and .png) and displays an error message to the user if they attempt to upload an incorrect file type.

      • setupNoEmployee

        public void setupNoEmployee()
        A method which sets up a blank instance of Employee for use when one isn't being display in GUI. Only used once at GUI initialisation.

      • loadSelectedEmployee

        public static void loadSelectedEmployee()
        A method which changes all GUI components to display the attribute values reflecting the currently selected Employee.

      • addNewEmployee

        public void addNewEmployee()
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        A method which adds a new Employee record into the database, taking in the values entered into the GUI components by the user. It uses the checkErrors() method to validate user input.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the SQL query fails to generate.

      • updateSelectedEmployee

        public void updateSelectedEmployee()
        A method which updates an existing Employee record in the database, taking in the values entered into the GUI components by the user. It uses the checkErrors() method to validate user input.

      • clearMainForm

        public void clearMainForm()
        A method which clears user input from the GUI along with their search query (if any), reseting the GUI to the initial appearance.

      • displayAllEmployees

        public void displayAllEmployees()
        A method which allows the user to retrieve all employees from the database using EmployeeDAO.selectAllEmployees(). They are then displayed in the GUI allowing the user to cycle backwards and forwards through individual records.

      • search

        public void search()
        A method which creates an instance of SearchForm and specifies the size, visibility, resizability, location on screen and how to respond when the user performs the close operation. Allows the user to search the database using the EmployeeDAO.generateSearchQuery(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method.

      • deleteSelectedEmployee

        public void deleteSelectedEmployee()
        A method which allows the user to delete the selected Employee from the database via the GUI. It uses the EmployeeDAO.deleteEmployeeById(java.lang.String) method in order to do so.

      • previousEmployee

        public void previousEmployee()
        A method which selects the previous Employee in a search query and updates the GUI components to reflect it's attribute values.

      • nextEmployee

        public void nextEmployee()
        A method which selects the next Employee in a search query and updates the GUI components to reflect it's attribute values.

      • checkErrors

        public java.lang.String checkErrors()
        A method which checks all user input and informs them if it is valid or not.
        Returns:
        A string detailing which user input contains errors if any.

      • alphabeticOnly

        public boolean alphabeticOnly(java.lang.String input)
        A method which takes in a string entered by user and checks each character to ensure that it is a letter. Used in checkErrors().
        Parameters:
        input - User input from a GUI text field.
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting validity of user input.

      • numericOnly

        public boolean numericOnly(java.lang.String input)
        A method which takes in a string entered by user and checks each character to ensure that it is a number. Used in checkErrors().
        Parameters:
        input - User input from a GUI text field.
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting validity of user input.

      • validDob

        public boolean validDob()
        A method which takes in a date of birth entered by user and checks to ensure that it is a valid date via checkValidDate(java.lang.String). Used in checkErrors().
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting validity of user input.

      • validStartDate

        public boolean validStartDate()
        A method which takes in a start date entered by user and checks to ensure that it is a valid date via checkValidDate(java.lang.String). Used in checkErrors().
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting validity of user input.

      • checkValidDate

        public boolean checkValidDate(java.lang.String date)
        A method which verifies if a date input by the user is a valid calendar date, including checking that the year is a leap year. Used in checkErrors().
        Parameters:
        date - A date passed in via validDob() or validStartDate().
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting validity of user input.

      • checkNiNum

        public boolean checkNiNum(java.lang.String niNum)
        A method that makes use of alphabeticOnly(java.lang.String) and numericOnly(java.lang.String) in order to check the validity of a national insurance number entered by the user. It also check that the input is nine characters in length. Used in checkErrors().
        Parameters:
        niNum - User input from the national insurance number text field.
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting validity of user input.

      • checkEmail

        public boolean checkEmail(java.lang.String email)
        A method that uses a regular expression in order to confirm that the user input is a valid email address. Used in checkErrors().
        Parameters:
        email - User input from the email text field.
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting validity of user input.

      • getEmployeeAge

        public int getEmployeeAge()
        A method which compares the Employee's date of birth to the current date in the user's system and works out the age. Used in checkErrors() to verify that the employee can legally work. Works in a similar fashion to getEmploymentLength().
        Returns:
        The age of the employee.

      • getEmploymentLength

        public int getEmploymentLength()
        A method which compares the Employee's start date to the current date in the user's system and works out the employment length. Used in checkErrors(). Works in a similar fashion to getEmployeeAge().
        Returns:
        The employment length of the employee.

      • compareDobAndStartDate

        public boolean compareDobAndStartDate()
        A method which checks the difference between an Employee's birth year and start year. It is used in checkErrors() to ensure that the DOB occurs before the start year.
        Returns:
        A boolean value reflecting validity of user input.

      • setSearchQuery

        public static void setSearchQuery(java.util.ArrayList<Employee> searchFormQuery)
        A method used by SearchForm to display user search results in the MainForm.
        Parameters:
        searchFormQuery - An ArrayList containing the user's search query results.

      • getSearchQuery

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Employee> getSearchQuery()
        A method used by SearchForm to display user search results in the MainForm.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the user's search query results.

      • getSearchQueryIndex

        public static int getSearchQueryIndex()
        A method used by SearchForm to display user search results in the MainForm.
        Returns:
        A number to set the first record to be displayed in the GUI.

      • setSearchQueryIndex

        public static void setSearchQueryIndex(int n)
        A method used by SearchForm to display user search results in the MainForm.
        Parameters:
        n - A number to set the first record to be displayed in the GUI.

      • getDao

        public static EmployeeDAO getDao()
        A method used by SearchForm to display user search results in the MainForm.
        Returns:
        A connection to the database.

      • getSelectedEmployee

        public static Employee getSelectedEmployee()
        A method used by SearchForm to display user search results in the MainForm.
        Returns:
        A record to be displayed in the GUI.

      • setSelectedEmployee

        public static void setSelectedEmployee(Employee employee)
        A method used by SearchForm to display user search results in the MainForm.
        Parameters:
        employee - A record to be displayed in the GUI.
